item.title: Wagner boss Prigozhin confirmed dead in plane crash - Moscow
item.description: Genetic analysis of the bodies was carried out following Wednesday's crash, Russian officials say.

item.title: Liverpool flood deaths: Two dead after driving car into floodwater
item.description: Passers-by fought to free the pair during the flash flood in Liverpool, but they were later pronounced dead.

item.title: P&O Britannia cruise ship crashes during Mallorca storms
item.description: A small number of people are being cared for onboard after sustaining minor injuries, P&O says.

item.title: GB athletics team finish with 10 medals
item.description: Great Britain won 10 medals in Budapest to equal their best medal haul at a World Championships.

item.title: Leeds Festival: The Killers, Central Cee and 1975 close the weekend
item.description: Rock music goes head-to-head with rap and pop, on the final night of the festival.

item.title: France to ban female students from wearing abayas in state schools
item.description: The education minister says female Muslim students will not be allowed to wear the loose-fitting robe.

item.title: Aston Villa team bus hit by brick after win at Burnley
item.description: Aston Villa's team bus is attacked following the game at Burnley, causing significant damage but no injuries.

item.title: Trump campaign raises $7.1m following historic Georgia mugshot
item.description: Merchandise bearing the ex-president's scowling face at his arrest on Thursday is flying off the shelves.

item.title: Labour rules out wealth tax if party wins next election
item.description: Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves says extra money for public services must come from economic growth.

item.title: Jacksonville shooter, 21, who killed three 'wrote racist manifestos'
item.description: The man who shot dead three Black people had a "disgusting ideology of hate", Jacksonville's sheriff says.

item.title: The Hundred 2023: Oval Invincibles beat Manchester Originals in thrilling men's final
item.description: Oval Invincibles stage a remarkable fightback to beat Manchester Originals and win the men's Hundred at Lord's.

item.title: Dorset Police open murder probe in Bournemouth after remains are found
item.description: The partial remains were found by a member of the public near the Manor Steps Zig Zag in Bournemouth.

item.title: Nessie hunters hear sounds but fail to record them
item.description: The mystery of the Loch Ness Monster lives on despite a weekend of amateur sleuthing.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Tory infighting warning and migrant tagging plans
item.description: Calls for an end to schisms among Tory MPs and plans for migrants to be given GPS tags lead the papers.

item.title: Chinaâ€™s summer of climate destruction
item.description: China sees both extreme heat and devastating floods, including in areas where flooding was unheard of.

item.title: How robotaxis are dividing San Francisco
item.description: The city has become the crucible of an experiment - are robotaxis ready for the streets?

item.title: The mobile game funding a revolution in Myanmar
item.description: Resistance to the military has come in many forms, including the development of an app-based game.

item.title: Why empty lorries are a problem and how to fix it
item.description: With one third of lorries in the UK driving empty, some hauliers are turning to technology for help.

item.title: Prigozhin and Putin: How a 25-year friendship turned ugly
item.description: It all began in St Petersburg when state security services mingled with the criminal underworld.

item.title: Blackswan: The K-pop girl group with no Korean members
item.description: The multinational girl group has sparked a debate about whether they can truly be considered K-pop.

item.title: Jenni Hermoso: Players and fans support Spain World Cup star in kiss row
item.description: The furore over the Spanish football chief's kiss on the lips generates protests at matches.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban ban women from visiting popular national park
item.description: Afghanistan's vice and virtue minister says female visitors to Band-e-Amir were not wearing hijabs properly.

item.title: Redheads celebrate fiery locks at festival
item.description: Hundreds of ginger-haired people from across the world took part in the three-day Dutch gathering.

item.title: Notting Hill Carnival: Children's day in pictures
item.description: The next generation of carnival performers took to the streets of west London for the children's day parade

item.title: Towering waterspout spotted off coast of Isle of Wight
item.description: The Met Office said the waterspout was spotted on Saturday morning.

item.title: Evidence found of German mass execution by French Resistance after D-Day
item.description: Casings and coins at a site in central France suggest prisoners were shot by the French Resistance after D-Day.

item.title: The old Scottish pub that found a new life in California
item.description: St Mungo Vintners shut in Glasgow in 1974 and its interior gathered dust in a warehouse for decades.

item.title: Banksy exhibition in Glasgow attracts record crowds
item.description: The solo show by graffiti artist Banksy in Glasgow was his first in 14 years and drew 180,000 visitors.

item.title: Ukraine war: Fighter ace and two other pilots killed in mid-air crash
item.description: Andrii Pilshchykov won fame taking part in dogfights over Kyiv during the early phase of Russia's invasion.

item.title: UK's oldest man advises moderation as he turns 111
item.description: John Tinniswood recommended "exercising the mind" as he was presented with a card from the King.

item.title: Viktor Hovland wins PGA Tour's season-ending FedEx Cup title at East Lake
item.description: Norway's Viktor Hovland hits a superb bogey-free seven-under-par 63 to win the PGA Tour's season-ending Tour Championship by five shots in Atlanta.

item.title: Newcastle 1-2 Liverpool: 'Agent of chaos' Darwin Nunez turns Liverpool saviour
item.description: Darwin Nunez goes from "agent of chaos" to "architect of a truly remarkable turnaround" in firing ten-man Liverpool to a remarkable comeback victory at Newcastle.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: Keely Hodgkinson wins 800m silver as Mary Moraa triumphs
item.description: Keely Hodgkinson is forced to settle for silver as Kenya's Mary Moraa triumphs in a thrilling 800m final at the World Championships.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: GB's Keely Hodgkinson wins second silver in 800m
item.description: Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson wins her second consecutive silver medal in the 800m at the World Athletics Championships as Kenya's Mary Moraa takes gold.

item.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Cash, Palhinha, Maddison, Sterling, Nunez and more
item.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his third Team of the Week this season?

item.title: The Hundred 2023: Oval Invincibles beat Manchester Originals to win men's Hundred final - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Tom Curran and Jimmy Neesham's 127-run partnership sees the Oval Invincibles recover from a 34-5 start to beat the Manchester Originals by 14 runs and win the men's Hundred final at Lords.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.
